sections.title: What's New
items: Snowflake Connector (+ Sample Configs): Connect directly to Snowflake from the connectors list, with sample connection configs so you can quickly test connections without starting from a blank form.

AI SQL Editor (Beta): Describe what you need in plain English—merging sheets, cleaning messy data, or building filtered views from raw sources—and we generate the SQL and results into a fresh, refreshable sheet. This is a premium feature; message us to get it enabled.

Single Window Architecture: Consolidated the splash screen, onboarding, and main interface into a single full-screen window to align with macOS 26 changes, reducing crashes and simplifying the experience.
Recent Activity Tracking: Projects now sort by what you actually worked on last, and screens remember the tab you were on so it’s easier to pick up where you left off.

sections.title: Fixes
items: Editing messages in the chat container works again after a regression in the last release.
Downloading connector configs no longer exposes database passwords in plain text; sensitive fields are now obfuscated in the exported JSON.

sections.title: Stability Improvements
items: Fixed startup crashes: Resolved an issue where OrcaSheets could crash immediately on launch for some users. OrcaSheets now opens reliably.

sections.title: What's New
items: SQL Connector Rebuilt — Two-step process: plug in credentials, pick your tables, then connect. You can test the connection before committing.
Merge Data — Combine multiple sheets with the same schema into one from Update Data in the grid toolbar. Delete source sheets after if you like.
Scratch Projects — Create an empty project without uploading a dummy CSV; pull data straight from your connectors.
Dashboard Upgrades — Create a new dashboard directly from the "Add to Dashboard" flow. Adding a visualisation no longer navigates you away from what you were working on.

sections.title: Fixes
items: Sankey charts no longer crash on cyclic data (cycles are filtered out and downloadable).
Copy/Paste commands work reliably again across the application.

sections.title: Improvements & Fixes
items: Delete data files directly and bulk delete multiple sheets for easier workspace management.
Window menu bar options fixed for a more reliable desktop experience.
Auto-updater popup redesigned for clearer, less disruptive update prompts.
Downloaded files now keep the correct file names.
Project paths handled correctly on Windows (correct path separators).

sections.title: New: Open Your Data Files Instantly
items: Make OrcaSheets your default app for CSV, XLSX, and Parquet files — double-click and start analysing immediately.
Open data files with a double-click; no more manual imports.
Launch files directly from downloads, email attachments, or shared folders for faster workflow.
Consistent OrcaSheets experience across your system whenever you open a data file.

sections.title: What's New
items: Bug fix for CSV import with "Time" column type.
Styling fixes for published chart and dashboard.
Based on your feedback! Thanks for helping us improve.
Release version 26.1.2

sections.title: What's New
items: Seamless Onboarding — No more token copy-paste required. Get started instantly.
Auto Updater — Updates happen automatically; no more manual "Download the latest version" messages.
Enjoy the smoother experience!

sections.title: New Visualizations
items: Stacked Chart — Compare component contributions within a total over time or across categories.
Chart From Chat — Generate a chart from a natural-language prompt (cloud-backed for speed and scalability).

sections.title: Interaction & Analysis
items: Column-Level Sorting & Multi-Sort — Sort any column with multiple sort priorities.
Summarization — One-click automated summary of key trends and patterns for the current data view.

sections.title: Filtering & Views
items: Save Filters — Persist filter configurations and reapply them instantly.
Auto Filter Naming — Saved filters get sensible default names.
Keyboard Navigation for Filter Panel — Navigate and apply filters without a mouse.

sections.title: Reliability
items: Soft-Fail Widgets — Failed widgets show a non-blocking error with Retry; other content keeps loading.

sections.title: Design & Accessibility
items: Harmonized Color Palette — Updated palette for readability, contrast, and accessibility.
Keyboard Navigation for Dashboard Widgets — Move focus between widgets and use actions via keyboard.

sections.title: Infrastructure
items: Prompt Processing Moved to Cloud — Natural-language features (chart from chat, summarization) run in the cloud for faster responses and scalability.
